channel.title: CVE Feed for SAP_SE -- SAP Enable Now
channel.description: The latest CVEs for SAP_SE -- SAP Enable Now

item.title: CVE-2023-36918|2024-10-23T16:22:12.521Z -- sap_se -- sap%20enable%20now
item.description: In SAP Enable Now - versions WPB_MANAGER 1.0, WPB_MANAGER_CE 10, WPB_MANAGER_HANA 10, ENABLE_NOW_CONSUMP_DEL 1704, the X-Content-Type-Options response header is not implemented, allowing an unauthenticated attacker to trigger MIME type sniffing, which leads to Cross-Site Scripting, which could result in disclosure or modification of information.

item.title: CVE-2024-34692|2024-08-02T02:59:22.200Z -- sap_se -- sap%20enable%20now
item.description: Due to missing verification of file type or content, SAP Enable Now allows an authenticated attacker to upload arbitrary files. These files include executables which might be downloaded and executed by the user which could host malware. On successful exploitation an attacker can cause limited impact on confidentiality and Integrity of the application.

item.title: CVE-2024-39596|2024-07-09T13:59:14.488Z -- sap_se -- sap%20enable%20now
item.description: Due to missing authorization checks, SAP Enable Now allows an author to escalate privileges to access information which should otherwise be restricted. On successful exploitation, the attacker can cause limited impact on confidentiality of the application.
